subject: Re: [junit] testing for Set or List returning methods
msgSnippet: ... I find assertEquals dead handy. It helps /a lot/ if the objects you put into the sets have a sane toString() method. If I needed them, I would write
messageBody:
On Tuesday 15 January 2008 07:10, PankajKHARE wrote:
>
> how to write junit test case of method which are return Set or List.
>
> for Example public Set getXXX();

I find assertEquals dead handy. It helps /a lot/ if the objects you
put into the sets have a sane toString() method.

If I needed them, I would write assertContains() or assertIsMember()
methods.

If you have a specific problem, perhaps it would help if you
confessed it.


--
"It took a very long time, much longer than the most /Sector General/
generous estimates." - James White
